result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Corrao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-4TH Offense, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 14CT2468.  Time served disposition.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.
Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and IID.  To be paid by October 3, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Filed: AODA Assessment  Form and Driver Safety Plan.
Court ordered defendant restricted to operation of vehicle equipped with an ignition interlock device (IID) for 24 months.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, voting.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony James Corrao appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Anthony James Corrao.  Attorney Dennis Murphy on behalf of Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in Court for State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing with Defendant's other Case, 14CT2468. Discussion placed on the record. Statements by the State, Defense counsel, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered Defendant to serve 171 DAYS in the House of Correction, Concurrent to Case 14CT2468, with credit for 171 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered Defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and IID) to be paid by October 3, 2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   

Court ordered AODA Assessment and Driver Safety Plan. Defendant to cooperate with any recommended treatment.  

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 

Court ordered Defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 24-months.  

Court ordered Defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) for 24-months.  

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

FILED: AODA Assessment Form and Driver Safety Plan.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.

Defendant Anthony James Corrao in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Anthony James Corrao.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. State filed an amended information;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY of the amended information.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNTS 2-5: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing addressed on the record, passed until 1:30pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Anthony James Corrao in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Anthony James Corrao.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing. Defense received a global offer that resolves this case along with pending matter 18CM4743, 19CT405, 19CT1621, and 14CT2468. Court accepts these matters for a global resolution. Court adjourns matter for plea/sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony James Corrao in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
*
Status conference held.  Defendant's pending Branch 30 cases have been authorized by Branch 30 to transfer to Branch 25.   Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
form, received and filed

Defendant Anthony James Corrao in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Anthony James Corrao in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Court appoints attorney Thomas Harris who is also present in Court. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Anthony James Corrao not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; granted. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Anthony J. Corrao, House of Correction - M6/31, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Anthony James Corrao not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Anthony James Corrao in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Anthony James Corrao in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony James Corrao appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
